content.question: A <math alttext="50 milliliter " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="C 6 H 14, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> is mixed with a <math alttext="50 milliliter " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, and the mixture is shaken vigorously. The two liquids do not stay mixed but instead form two separate layers. The density of hexane is <math alttext="0.66 gram per milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.66</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/</mtext><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the density of water is <math alttext="1.00 gram per milliliter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/</mtext><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A <math alttext="1.0 gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="I 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to the mixture, which is shaken again. Which of the following best predicts what happens to the <math alttext="I 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be found mainly in the top layer because it will dissolve more in the <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> will be found mainly in the bottom layer because it will dissolve more in the <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> will be found mainly in the top layer because it will dissolve more in the <math alttext="C 6 H 14, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> will be found mainly in the bottom layer because it will dissolve more in the <math alttext="C 6 H 14, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="I 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> will be found mainly in the top layer because it will dissolve more in the <math alttext="C 6 H 14, liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.B: Formulate a hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
